intro: Heterotrichum dubium, commonly known as the mossy liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, acrocarpous liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a dorsiventral leafy shoot system, and its leaves are usually elongated and arranged in a spiral pattern. It reproduces through spores, which are produced in capsules that develop on the tips of the stems. Heterotrichum dubium is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
